title: Prologue4
opening: Marth and his knights took refuge in a forest near Altea's borders, lying low while they waiting for the right chance to escape the kingdom. Before long, the enemy grew less watchful: the time to slip away had come. Still, the prince could not quell the sadness in his heart for his sister Elice.

intro.speaker: Malledus
intro.line: Prince Marth. ...Sire? Sire! Are you listening?!

intro.speaker: Malledus
intro.line: Get ahold of yourself, Sire! I know how you grieve, but the Gra host that pursues us will not be interested. We must keep moving, and with all haste at that.

intro.speaker: Marth
intro.line: I...I'm sorry. These thoughts are hard to put aside.

intro.speaker: Malledus
intro.line: From here, we will cross out of Altea and begin our escape to Talys. I trust you are prepared?

intro.speaker: Marth
intro.line: Talys... I've heard the name. An island kingdom to the east, isn't it?

intro.speaker: Malledus
intro.line: That is correct. The king there was a good friend to your father- and perhaps more importantly, a true friend. It was Princess Elice's wish that you seek refuge in Talys should things ever go awry.

intro.speaker: Malledus
intro.line: I've arranged for a boat to take us from the northeast shore. But to get there, we'll first need to cut through a prison to the north. I managed to come by a key to the premises. Let me hand it over.

intro.speaker: Malledus
intro.line: Now, on the road, you may notice people who seem to be fighting for Gra against their own wishes. Before you resort to your blade, you should try talking to them first.

visit.speaker: Young Man
visit.line: Boy, I don’t envy you! The enemy horde is closing in on you faster’n a bolt of Thoron. You and your friends had better hightail it on outta here!

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: Sometimes victory on a battlefield requires that someone you care about make a sacrifice. But parting with one comrade may be the only way to meet another. You need to accept your losses in life and move forward.

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: My word! Aren’t you–No, you cannot stay here! Run! Before their soldiers come back! Here, this is the bow my granddaughter always used. Take it, sire! Please, promise you’ll stay safe...

battle.speaker: Captain
battle.line: Enemies south of the prison?

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Yes, sir. Not many of 'em, but the scouts say they're a tough bunch all the same. And guess who's with 'em...

battle.speaker: Captain
battle.line: ...You're saying the prince is coming this way?

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Yes, sir. How ought we proceed? The main force ‘as yet to arrive, and- to be honest, sir- we need 'em.

battle.speaker: Captain
battle.line: Bah! You're cowed too easily. We can win...if we set a trap.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Er...a trap, sir?

battle.speaker: Captain
battle.line: The prince of Altea will be ours. Just do as I tell you, and we'll pluck this royal plum long before the main force can show up to steal all the glory. Heh...

battle.speaker: Ruffian
battle.line: You! Inside!

battle.speaker: Gordin
battle.line: Grrrmph...

battle.speaker: Ruffian
battle.line: Heh. I thought Altea was the great ‘ero Anri's kingdom! Didn't take more'n a couple of days to break you, now did it, Gaggles?

battle.speaker: Gordin
battle.line: Mmph! Arrumph!

battle.speaker: Ruffian
battle.line: What's the matter, Gaggles? Can't talk cause you're gagged, Gaggles? Ba ha ha! I'll letcha in on a little secret. Altea's little princeling is on ‘is way ‘ere right this moment.

battle.speaker: Ruffian
battle.line: Ooh, but sad for you, you look awful dangerous in the uniform... MISTER GRA SOLDIER! Ha! Soon as the prince sees you, ‘e'll say, Yow! It's an enemy ambush!-And that'll be the end of you.

battle.speaker: Gordin
battle.line: Gugrrrmph!

battle.speaker: Ruffian
battle.line: Once the prince sticks you like a pig, we get to call him Marth the Tyrant, coz ‘e kills ‘is own countrymen.

battle.speaker: Ruffian
battle.line: Won't that be an ‘oot!

battle.speaker: Gordin
battle.line: Rrrmph.

battle.speaker: Ruffian
battle.line: So long, Gaggles! Better start praying to your ‘igher deity of choice!

battle.speaker: Jiol
battle.line: Listen, men. Your target is the prince. Find the prince of Altea and bring me his head served on a shield!

battle.speaker: Marth
battle.line: Look there!

battle.speaker: Malledus
battle.line: No...Anri save us...Of all the places to be beset! Sire, that is Gra's main force- and they are accompanied by the knights of Grust's Sable Order. Our chances of routing them are slim, I'm afraid, and those of slipping away undetected afterward, all but nil...

battle.speaker: Marth
battle.line: Then we've no hope?

battle.speaker: Malledus
battle.line: I...I can think of one strategy. We could leave a decoy behind for when the enemy catches up.

battle.speaker: Marth
battle.line: A decoy?

battle.speaker: Malledus
battle.line: It's you they're after, sire. Were one of your men to stay behind disguised as you...Well, the enemy ought to take the bait. That would give you, and the others time to escape.

battle.speaker: Malledus
battle.line: One of your men must make for that fortress on the south highroad. He will act as a decoy by dressing as you and luring the enemy force away.

battle.speaker: Marth
battle.line: But Malledus, how will he find his way back to us?

battle.speaker: Malledus
battle.line: Sire...He may not. You must part with one of your comrades. There is no other way.

battle.speaker: Marth
battle.line: ...Well, I will find a way! You cannot expect me to agree to...to abandon one of our own to a death at the hands of the enemy. Surely there must be another way...

battle.speaker: Malledus
battle.line: Forgive me, sire...But this is our only chance. You know as well as I do that you must not die here today.

battle.speaker: Malledus
battle.line: No, sire! Get back here! One of your other men must take that position!

battle.speaker: Enemy Soldier 1
battle.line: Look! It's...it's Prince Marth!

battle.speaker: Enemy Soldier 2
battle.line: Oh yeah? Who's that, then? That bloke over there is dressed in the same clothes. Could be either of 'em.

battle.speaker: Jiol
battle.line: Simpletons! Use your heads! One of them ran; the other didn't. What does that tell you? Easy! The one who stayed behind is trying to buy time for the one who fled.

battle.speaker: Enemy Solider
battle.line: So, er...the one who took off is-

battle.speaker: Jiol
battle.line: The real prince, you idiot, yes! Hie, troops, after him! Put that craven whip to the sword!

battle.speaker: Marth
battle.line: Wait! Quickly, Malledus, we must head south and rescue him!

battle.speaker: Malledus
battle.line: No, sire. We have to press on.

battle.speaker: Marth
battle.line: Press on? (Insert name) might be dying back there!

battle.speaker: Malledus
battle.line: If he were, then why would you be so selfish as to let him die in vain? Honor him, by allowing his life and his choice to mean something!

battle.speaker: Marth
battle.line: ...All right.

battle.speaker: Marth
battle.line: I will honor him. ...I will go.

battle.speaker: Captain
battle.line: The prince fled south? Bah! Seems the plum's fallen too far from our tree... No matter. Open the north door! We can still crush the Altean rabble he left behind...

battle.speaker: Marth
battle.line: Blast! That archer was on our side!

battle.speaker: Captain
battle.line: They killed the captive? Heh heh... What fools! Hie, let's give them the punishment fools deserve! Open the north door! Lure them out and strike them down!

battle.speaker: Captain
battle.line: All but the prince have been slain? Good. Open the north door! The little whelp is ours now!

battle.speaker: Malledus
battle.line: Sire, there is a village over yonder. Its residents may be willing to help. Why don't you try paying them a visit?

battle.speaker: Draug
battle.line: Prince Marth! Make haste, sire!

battle.speaker: Marth
battle.line: Draug, is that you? What are you doing here?

battle.speaker: Norne
battle.line: Draug, sir! The enemy has crossed the border from the west! They’ll be upon us soon!

battle.speaker: Draug
battle.line: Right, we’re on our way. Sire, this is Norne. She heard wind of our struggles and wishes to fight for Altea.

battle.speaker: Norne
battle.line: Prince Marth, ’tis an honor. By your leave, though, I’ll be savin' the curtsy-bobbin' for later. Quickly, sire!

battle.speaker: Jiol
battle.line: This is...the wrong prince? No! You dare make a fool of me? Kill him! Make this faux prince SUFFER!

recruit-battle.speaker: Gordin
recruit-battle.line: May I suffer for my sins...

recruit-talk.speaker: Marth
recruit-talk.line: Huh? You've been gagged? Here, I'll get that... Wait, I know you! You're one of our archers, er...

recruit-talk.speaker: Gordin
recruit-talk.line: Gordin, sire! My name is Gordin. The enemy captured me and left me in this mortifying state.

recruit-talk.speaker: Marth
recruit-talk.line: I see. Well, I'm glad you're unharmed. But I'm afraid we cannot stay here a moment longer. Stay behind me and-

recruit-talk.speaker: Gordin
recruit-talk.line: I can fight, sire! If you have a bow I could use, I would be honored to fight at your side.

character-falls.speaker: Jagen
character-falls.line: Heh, these old bones are still good for something. Farewell, my prince. Live, and grow strong...

character-falls.speaker: Cain
character-falls.line: Glory to Altea, land of my birth! Farewell, sire! Fortune protect you...

character-falls.speaker: Abel
character-falls.line: Good... Altea's hope is restored. Farewell sire. Fortune protect you...

character-falls.speaker: Frey
character-falls.line: Count this knight honored to die in the service of his prince. Live, sire, and grow strong...

character-falls.speaker: Gordin
character-falls.line: I was dead anyway till you came, sir... If I'm to die again, at least let me die for you. Fortune protect you sire...

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: Look, sire. See how Altea shrinks on the horizon...

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: I am a craven. Powerless to save my sister, to staunch my kingdom's wounds; to ease my people's fears...

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: This...was your only recourse, sire. But surely, one day, you will be able to set things right...

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: "Surely"? Why do words of such conviction smack so much of uncertainty when spoken? Not surely, Jagen. Assuredly. Gra will pay for their acts. Today, though, allow me to wallow in this pain, to feel every awful twist of it. I never want to forget.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: I will return, Altea! Your prince will return to you one day!
